body:
@mhils How should it look like? 
I see two and a half variants :)
1) Like in mitmproxy 2.0.x. When we press `e` in flowview, Part overlay appears along with message in status bar: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20267977/35242172-801cffd6-ffc1-11e7-9dd4-c71536864476.png)
Then when I press the certain button, the corresponding editor opens.

2) Each line in Part overlay has its shortcut written on this line.
When I press the certain button:
a) The corresponding line is focused  - I need to press `Enter` to confirm my decision and enter the editor.
b) I directly get into the corresponding editor.
Do you have any thoughts about it?

@kajojify: I think both 1) and 2b) are good alternatives. My initial idea was that we have `console.choose.cmd` auto-select keyboard shortcuts so that it maybe looks like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1019198/35243179-3cf94160-ffbc-11e7-9594-cbb678216487.png)
(this could get aesthetically nicer if we reorder the entries)

or like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1019198/35243292-a70fc3ee-ffbc-11e7-8ad5-52a4da7ab711.png)

Looking at it now, I think the last option is the nicest one, both in terms of implementation and UX. No definite opinion though. ðŸ™‚
Ok, thank you. I'll try to work on it :)

I think, it also makes sense to implements shortcuts for _mode_ overlay
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20267977/35506376-b8340538-04f1-11e8-9ed2-88ca6368ea94.png)
@kajojify: both use `console.choose` so it should be the same code :)

@mhils 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20267977/35675470-cadb2de0-0750-11e8-9308-b8ff9fc5c6b7.png)

What do you think? :)
Or with `key` highlighting.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20267977/35675687-9f3a7b36-0751-11e8-9f5e-22d419242418.png)
@kajojify: very awesome, I do like the key highlighting variant! ðŸ˜ƒ  Have you tried moving the numbers to the front? How does that look?

Fantastic - send a PR! Depending on how difficult it is, it'd be cool to
have the "(6) " chunk as a part of the selection as well, but post your
code first and we'll see. Great work! :-)

On Thu, Feb 1, 2018 at 1:56 PM, Samoilenko Roman <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

@mhils do we have to implement the feature, which lets users change these shortcuts? :)

Please no! :)
This should be very generic for console.choose, always 1-9a-z.
